brief: Launch a new real-money online rummy tournament format for Games24x7.

sections.problem_statement: Games24x7 aims to expand its online gaming portfolio by introducing a new real-money rummy tournament format. The current offering lacks variety in tournament structures, potentially limiting user engagement and revenue growth. This new format needs to comply with legal regulations, provide an exciting and fair gaming experience, and integrate seamlessly with the existing platform while attracting both new and existing players.

goals_and_success_metrics.success_metric: Achieve 20% increase in daily active users within 3 months of launch
Generate 15% increase in overall rummy revenue within 6 months of launch
Increase 30-day retention rate by 10% for players participating in new tournament format
Maintain a fraud detection rate of 99.9% for all tournament games

user_stories.story: I want to participate in short-duration tournaments with low entry fees so that I can enjoy competitive play without a significant time or financial commitment.
I want to join high-stakes tournaments with substantial prize pools so that I can maximize my potential earnings.
I want to easily understand the tournament structure and rules so that I can confidently participate without feeling overwhelmed.
I want to see a variety of tournament formats and schedules so that I can find options that fit my playing style and availability.
I want to have flexible tools to create and manage different tournament structures so that I can offer diverse and engaging experiences to players.

constraints: Must comply with all applicable real-money gaming regulations in target markets
Tournament format must be compatible with existing Games24x7 platform infrastructure
User interface must be responsive and work across desktop and mobile devices
Payment processing and prize distribution must be secure and instantaneous
Tournament system must be scalable to handle concurrent players during peak times
Anti-cheating measures must be implemented to ensure fair play

milestones.milestone: Complete tournament format design and rules
Develop and integrate tournament system with existing platform
Conduct internal testing and bug fixes
Soft launch with limited user group
Full public launch of new tournament format

sections.hypothesis: Offering tiered entry fees will increase participation across different player segments
sections.rationale: Different players have varying budgets and risk appetites. Tiered entry fees cater to a wider audience, potentially increasing overall participation.
sections.test: Launch the tournament with 3 tiers of entry fees (low, medium, high) and compare participation rates across tiers. Analyze player demographics and spending patterns for each tier.

sections.hypothesis: Implementing a progressive knockout format will increase player engagement and retention
sections.rationale: Progressive knockout formats keep more players in the game longer, potentially increasing excitement and the likelihood of return participation.
sections.test: Compare player engagement metrics (time spent, games played) and retention rates between the new progressive knockout format and traditional single-elimination tournaments over a 3-month period.

sections.hypothesis: Offering in-game power-ups for purchase will increase revenue per player
sections.rationale: Power-ups add an element of strategy and can give players a perceived edge, potentially encouraging in-game purchases and increasing overall revenue.
sections.test: Introduce a set of power-ups in the tournament and track the purchase rate, average spend per player, and impact on tournament outcomes. Compare revenue metrics with and without power-ups available.

sections.hypothesis: Implementing a leaderboard with real-time updates will increase player motivation and session length
sections.rationale: Real-time leaderboards create a sense of competition and progress, potentially motivating players to play longer and more frequently to improve their ranking.
sections.test: Introduce a real-time leaderboard for the tournament and measure average session length, frequency of play, and player feedback. Compare these metrics to tournaments without real-time leaderboards.
